info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 3:45PM EDT until May 23 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL HARNETT...EAST CENTRAL LEE...SOUTHWESTERN WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 344 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Fuquay-Varina, or 13 miles southeast of Pittsboro, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, New Hill, Lake Wheeler and Raven Rock State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
